result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler J Mangler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The defendant can pay $50 per month with the first payment due 5-1-15 and each subsequent payment will be due the 1st of every month thereafter until paid in full
.

To be served on Electronic Monitoring with Justice Support Services
.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with the sentence the defendant is currently serving
.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler J Mangler

records.addlTxt:
from Jeff S, JSS   re: Def was sentenced to serve 90 days house arrest on EM.  Def is currently at ATTIC & being monitored on EM w/ Probation.  Probation's monitoring only includes a curfew of 6pm to 6am Mon thru Fri & curfew of 5 pm to 8am on Sat & Sun.  PO advised def is required to be monitored by probation while at ATTIC, so if he is required to also be monitored by JSS w/ stricter requirements, he would need a 2nd ankle bracelet.  Could def's sentence requirements be modified to match the requirements of Probation & Parole?
PER SLH:  ok

State by Kellis / Def w/ Atty Allan Beatty
Plea Quest & Waiver filed
Victim Impact Stmt filed
Ct 1 - Def pleads GUILTY
CRT:  Plea is F&V made - sufficient factual basis exists to support plea - finds def guilty
CRT'S SENTENCE:  Def to serve 90 days CJ - to be served on EM w/ JSS Concurrent w/ sentence def is now serving, w/credit for 1 day;  Pay Crt costs/fees totalling $443 - can pay $50 per mo w/ first payment due 5-1-15 & each subsequent payment will be due the 1st of every month thereafter;  Fail to pay = 1 day CJ for each $50 owed
